args.text: What do you want to do?
I don’t know, Patty. What do you want to do?
Not fair, Brad. I asked you first.
Patty and Brad. Your two best friends. Arguing. As usual. It’s the last week of August, and they haven’t stopped fighting since summer vacation started.
Patty likes being bossy. You don’t mind, though. It's hard to win a fight with her anyway.
There’s nothing to do. I guess I’ll just go home.
He shoves his hands in his pockets. His shoulders slump. You guess Brad is kind of a wimp — even if he is your best friend.
You’re so boring, Brad.
Whenever Patty complains, her freckles really pop out. Now there are about a million of them spread across her face.
Hey! I know what we should do!
Let’s bike over to Bennet’s Field and watch them set up the carnival!
“I don’t know,” you answer. “It’s getting dark, and Mom said I have to be in by nine.”
It’s only a quick bike ride. Are you some kind of wimp?
Brad calling you a wimp? You can’t believe it! “Okay. Okay,” you agree.
“But if it’s as bad as last year, there won’t be much to see. Don’t you remember Terror Track? It turned out to be a baby choo-choo train.”
It doesn’t matter what you say. Patty’s made up her mind. You’re going to ride over to the carnival.
A hot, humid breeze blows in your face as you pedal along. Patty’s in the lead. No surprise. And Brad’s puffing behind you.
It’s dark by the time you reach Bennet’s Field. You and your friends drop your bikes in the grass and race across the moonlit field, toward the huge wooden fence that surrounds the carnival.
As you reach the carnival entrance, you hear music coming from inside. Not the usual corny organ stuff, but something... strange. It sounds familiar and new at the same time.
Brad stretches his neck to try to peer over the fence. But no luck. The fence is way too high.
Patty jiggles the padlock on the gate. It’s sealed shut.
I guess we’ll have to wait until tomorrow night when the carnival opens.
No way! Let’s climb the fence. Now!
Are you crazy? We'll get caught!
Come on. There’s probably no one in there.
Your friends turn to you to cast the deciding vote. You glance at your watch. It’s almost 9:00 P.M. You need to get home soon...

choices.text: Climb the fence to get inside.

args.text: Wh-what do you mean?
I just had an idea. A great idea. I want you kids to stay and try out the rides before the grand opening tomorrow.
Cool!
“Are you sure it’s all right with the owner?” you ask.
I’m Big Al, the manager. And what I say around here goes.
Big Al digs around in his checkered jacket and pulls out three maps. He hands one to each of you.
Study them carefully. If you have any questions, ask them now.
Your eyes fall upon the map. You have a question. But when you gaze up, Big Al is gone. He’s vanished!
A whole carnival to ourselves! Where should we start?
You stare down at your map once again. You notice that the carnival is split in half. On one side are the rides. On the other is the midway.
“Come on, run!” you yell to Patty and Brad as you spin around. “There’s got to be another way out!”
Big Al blows a whistle. Its shrill blast hurts your ears. He blows it again and, suddenly, dozens of carnival people appear out of nowhere.
But they don’t look the way they did before. Some have green flesh. Some are deathly white. Their rotting skin hangs from their bones. Their eyes glow an eerie yellow.
You watch in horror as more and more of them appear. Your legs won’t budge. You’re terrified! You stand there — frozen — in a trance.
They’re ghosts! That’s why they’re wearing those old-fashioned clothes. They’re dead!
Watch out! Over there! That ghost... It’s coming right at us. Run!
“Let’s do it!” you say to your friends. “Let’s climb the fence!”
Patty is halfway up before you finish speaking. You let Brad go next. You’re last.
It’s a hard climb. But you make it to the top, swing your legs over, and tumble down. You land on the grass. You’re inside!
You and your friends gaze around. It’s pretty dark — the only light comes from torches. Dinky rides. Hot dog wagons.
Then the lights start to flicker on in every corner of the field — the rides start to move. It’s as if the whole place is magically coming to life.
Hey! Look at that giant roller coaster! They never had a roller coaster before!
Yeah, and the whole place is a lot bigger than last year!
This is awesome!
Patty sprints toward the rides.
You and Brad take off after Patty. You all stop in front of the roller coaster.
Wow! It’s like a rocket to outer space!
Beyond the roller coaster, you spy a castle surrounded by a moat. And a spooky-looking haunted house sitting high atop a hill.
These are the coolest rides I’ve ever seen! They still have that dumb choo-choo train, but we could ride this stuff all night!
Patty grabs your arm and tugs you over to the other side of the carnival — to the midway. Brad races after you.
The dinky wooden booths from last year are gone. In their place are giant video games and huge spinning wheels studded with hundreds of blinking colored lights!
Get a load of that!
You and Patty spin around. You can’t believe what you see!
You wander over to the Wheel of Chance and notice two strange things.
First, the sign says 'Wheel of No Chance.' Then you hear a barker’s voice calling, “Step right up!” But there’s no one there.
No one but a green-and-yellow parrot.
Excuse me, is this game open?
No, I’m standing by this wheel for my health. Now, do you want to spin or what?
The parrot is obviously annoyed. “Mammals,” he mutters. “Can’t live with them, can’t live without them.”
You steal a glance around. Maybe you should skip this game. But Big Al sneaks up behind you.
Spin. You must earn enough points to win.
But how will I know if I have enough points?
Spin!
You spin the wheel...
Where does it land?
You’ve decided not to sneak into the carnival? You’re going home instead?
Well, it’s a good thing Patty usually makes all the decisions. Otherwise, you’d never have any fun! And this book would be over before it began!
Go ahead. Take a deep breath. Then go climb the fence. You’re not scared — are you?
You’ve decided to help the freaks. As you race down the midway, you spot Brad and Patty.
Listen, guys. We’ve got a big problem.
You take a deep breath and tell them all about Madame Zeno and the blue card.
So... somebody might need our help in the back of the Freak Show.
What’s a freak?
Remember the poster we saw? The three-headed man and the lady with the snake body?
Are they really real?
Sure they’re real. I once saw a bearded lady at the circus.
I don’t know... It sounds kind of creepy.
Well, Madame Zeno said this was my fate. I’m going to help them. Are you guys in?
You bet!
Okay, okay. I’ll go.
Then let’s hurry!

choices.text: Race to the back of the Freak Show.

args.text: You run to the right. 'Follow me!' you cry out to Patty and Brad.
You run faster than you’ve ever run in your life. Your sides ache, but you keep on going.
When your chest is about to burst, you finally stop. And hear a crash behind you. Then at both sides of you. Then in front of you. Trapping you.
Welcome to the Reptile’s Petting Zoo.
Reptile’s Petting Zoo? You thought the sign said Reptile Petting Zoo.
Our alligator has been so lonely. Waiting and waiting — for his new pets to arrive. And here you are — finally.
THE END
The room is dark, but all around you, you hear hushed moans. 'Help us! Help us!'
We’re in a prison. And look at the prisoners! They’re weird!
As your eyes adjust, you see cell after cell. There’s an enormous fat lady, a giant, a dwarf, a young lady with boa constrictors, and a woman with a long black beard!
We’re the freakssss. Every night when the sssshow endssss, the masssster lockssss ussss up.
“The master? You mean Big Al is —” you start to say.
“You must help us!” the giant interrupts from another cell.
Sssssssh. The master’sssss coming — you musssstn’t be here! Go! That way!
She points to a door down the hall.

choices.text: Stay and talk to Big Al.

args.text: You reach out slowly and touch the red card.
To your amazement, a 3-D heart magically appears and rises from the flat surface. Then it starts to beat! Tha-dump, tha-dump.
You lean closer to figure out the trick.
“Yowwwww!” you screech and jerk back to avoid the warm red liquid that nearly squirts in your eye. It looks like blood.
Wow! Cool effect. How did you do it?
Turn over the card. Do it now!
You do as you’re told. No weird pictures or fortunes. All you see are the numbers 1, 3, 2 shimmering in gold script against a midnight background.
What does it mean?
You will know when the time is right. It could save your life!
Round and round the wheel spins. It finally lands on number 15. NO CHANCE.
No chance. Does that mean what you think it means? Yes. That’s exactly what it means. You have met...
THE END
Big Al is leading a large group of people. As they come closer, you hear them chanting.
PLAY OR PAY. PLAY OR PAY.
Hi! Who are all those people?
Welcome to the Carnival of Horrors. You must play or pay. We have many games on our midway. You must play two.
He practically spits the word must out.
If you succeed, you can win prizes. But if you lose, you pay with your life!
Boy, he’s really laying it on thick, you think. But it’s a pretty cool gimmick.
No one goes home, until they play. You must play two games. And survive.
You glance around at the two closest games. Guess Your Weight on Mars and the Wheel of Chance. You have to pick one to start.

choices.text: Play Guess Your Weight on Mars.

args.text: You take a few steps along the midway. You notice the crowd of people surrounding Big Al. They’re still chanting, 'PAY OR PLAY. PAY OR PLAY.'
You break through the crowd and grab Big Al’s arm. 'Hey! Do you know where my friends are?'
Certainly. They’re right over there!
Patty! Brad! Come on! We’ve got to go! This carnival is evil!
Not before The Final Challenge!
The space lady slowly circles you as she sizes you up from head to toe.
Hmmmm, I think you weigh thirty-eight pounds.
Thirty-eight pounds! Boy, are you wrong!
I’m never wrong.
She snaps her fingers and two enormous guards appear. They each take one of your arms and drag you out of the courtyard.
“I don’t weigh thirty-eight pounds!” you yell. But then you remember. It isn’t your weight on Earth that matters. It’s your weight on Mars.
You'd better find out quickly, because something tells you that what Big Al said about having to survive might be true.
You land on number 19. 'Double or nothing. Double or nothing,' two voices behind you echo.
You whirl around — and gasp! It’s a man with two heads.
Congratulations. You win ten points. Quit while you’re ahead!
Ahead, get it? A head! Hahahaha!
Shut up.
You shut up. Ten points is nothing. You better spin again. And this time it’s double or nothing. You get double the points wherever you land.
Which head should you listen to?

choices.text: Spin again (you don't have enough points).
Quit spinning (you have enough, and haven't played Guess Your Weight).
Quit spinning (you have enough, and have played Guess Your Weight).

args.text: It seems as if hours have passed. Or maybe it’s only minutes. You try to unclasp your hands. But they won’t budge. It’s as if your arms are glued around your knees.
You can’t blink an eyelid. Your body is paralyzed. You can’t even scream.
A door opens and two men dressed in overalls and wearing gas masks amble in. Finally. They’re here to rescue you!
Looks like the perfume worked.
Yeah. And just in time. We needed a new dummy for the Real-Life Space Display.
They pick up your rigid body and carry you out. No wonder those astronauts in the silver tunnel looked so real! Sorry. You can’t escape.
Next time, you promise yourself, you’ll stick with the baby rides. But then you remember — there isn’t going to be a next time... because this is...
THE END
You’re outside — standing in Bennet’s Field — gazing at the fence that surrounds the carnival.
I guess we’ll have to wait until tomorrow night when the carnival opens.
No way. Let’s climb the fence.
What’s going on here? You guessed it. The silver locker was a time machine. You’ve gone back in time to the first moment you spotted the carnival.
Now it appears as if you have to start all over again — fighting horror after horror, right up to...
THE END
You’re pretty sure that the space lady guessed wrong! The two goons shove you inside the planet simulation chamber. It’s a long narrow tube, and it’s really stuffy.
You step up on the scale. You check the readout. Boy, oh, boy! The space lady is wrong!
I won! I won!
Back outside you collect your prize. It’s a huge chocolate bar. You take a big bite out of it and stuff the rest in your pocket.
You gaze around. The coast is clear. But a heavy hand clamps down on your shoulder from behind.
It’s time to play another game.

choices.text: Play Wheel of Chance (you haven't tried it).
Go to The Final Challenge (you've already played Wheel of Chance).

args.text: You yank on the reins. But your horse plows ahead, pulling you closer to the chopping, chopping, chopping blades.
Brad squinches down in the cart and buries his head in his lap.
Patty jumps into the front seat with you. Together you pull on the reins and scream, “Whoa, fellow! Whoa!”
It’s no use! We’d better jump!
You stare over the side. You’re riding along a narrow ridge with a deep drop! If you jump, you’ll plunge to your death!
Then you glance up ahead — and spot a safer place to leap. Great!
Look at the elves! They chop at set times. If we can get the horse to move faster, we can miss the axes!
That’s dumb, we should jump!
Carnival workers. The carnival workers who set up the same rinky-dink carnival you go to every summer. You can’t believe your eyes.
Huh?
Hey, kids! Get away from that ride. The carnival doesn’t start till tomorrow night.
You gaze around in wonder at the faded games, the baby rides, the tacky food stands. For the first time in your life, it all looks great!
We’ll be there! This is the greatest carnival I’ve ever seen!
THE END
Seconds later your head and the back of your feet slam into the wall. You’re hanging upside down — in the middle of a gigantic magnetic wheel!
Are you ready for The Final Challenge?
Of course not! LET ME DOWN!
We’ll let you down — but not until you face The Final Challenge. One spin will decide your fate. If you win, you go. If you lose, you stay here forever.
Big Al approaches the wheel. Brad and Patty are holding on to each other. Your heart is pounding. He gives the wheel — with you on it — a hard turn.
Where will it stop? Guess!
Hey, wait up!
You yell to Brad and Patty as you sprint through the Space Coaster gate. They both ignore you and charge straight ahead. You follow them into a narrow tunnel that leads to the boarding area.

You gaze down at the floor. Black rubber. It makes you walk with a strange bounce. Every few feet there is a round porthole window. You see astronauts planting flags on the moon. They look totally real.
After a long climb, you finally arrive at the loading area. A sleek bullet-shaped capsule whooshes up and stops right beside you.
It has three sections. Brad climbs into the last section. You leap into the front. Patty’s left with the middle section. And suddenly you’re trapped!
The crowd is closing in. Your pockets are empty — you have nothing to defend yourself with. So you run!
You spot a crack in the wall, next to the wheel. It’s small, but you can probably make it.
Follow me!
You squeeze through the opening. It leads to a backstage area — and then to the flap of another tent.
Come on! We can slip under this tent.
The three of you duck in and find yourself surrounded by another crowd. They are all seated in chairs. And they don’t move. They just stare at you with glassy eyes.
What’s the big idea? You’re going to embarrass the giant into helping you.
Hey, you. You know, you’re a real wimp.
He looks at you as if he can’t believe what he hears. Patty and Brad look at you as if you’re crazy.
You sit here all day, taking orders from that creep, Big Al. You could bend those bars and escape — but you won’t. Because you are a wimp — W-I-M-P — wimp.
The giant stands. You gaze up. He’s over fifteen feet tall. He lumbers over to you. He isn’t smiling.
Is your plan going to work? It’s out of your control now. Look out the window.
You stumble down the corridor to your right. As you peer from side to side, you are met with hundreds of images of — you! And you look pretty baffled. And scared.
Hey, I could use some help!
Silence. You pound your fist against the wall.
The wall starts to move. Just an inch or two closer to you! You take a step back — but the wall behind you is moving, too.
The walls are moving together. They’re closing in on you. You’re going to be crushed!
You’re falling... falling... You can’t think of anything else to do, so you start flapping your arms like a bird.
At that moment a huge gust of air shoots up from under you and blows you back onto the bridge.
Breathing hard, you run the rest of the way across the rickety span. When you reach the safety of the other side, you glance back. And gasp!
The bridge and the midway beyond it have vanished! Only a black void remains!
You spin around to face the House of Horrors. Up close it appears really, really creepy. Cobwebs drip down from its roof and an eerie yellow light glows inside.
Next to the house you spot a sign that reads BOAT TRIP TO NOWHERE. There are amazing speedboats that you can drive yourself.

choices.text: Try the Boat Trip to Nowhere.

args.text: You snap your head around to the right — where you hear footsteps coming toward you.
You are facing a short man with wrinkly skin and bloodshot eyes. His bushy black hair resembles a scouring pad. His evil expression makes you cringe.
But he’s nothing compared to the 'things' in back of him — two seven-foot-tall monsters. One has blue horns and bulging red eyes. The other has scaly skin and an alligator snout.
The trio all wear lab coats. From the eager way they’re looking at you, you realize that you are the lab rat. You struggle, but you’re trapped in the webbing.
Welcome to my humble laboratory. I am Dr. Frank N. Stone, the mastermind who created the Carnival of Horrors.
The Carnival of Horrors! You don’t like the sound of that!
Your boat glides through the channel at high speed to Booger Bog. Water sprays up into your face. But soon you have to slow down. Trees have suddenly sprung up all around you.
In the dark light, their limbs take on the shape of gnarled arms with blackened, bony fingers at the ends. Are they reaching out for you?
You slowly weave the boat through the twisted trunks and branches. The trees rustle as if they’re whispering. The leaves slap against your face. Slap. Slap. Slap.
Your heart starts hammering away in your chest. Something swipes at your hair! What was that?
You glance once more at the dwarf. He lets out an evil cackle. There’s no way you can trust him. Besides, you can hear music up ahead.
No, thanks. I don’t need any help.
Oh, yes, you do.
He sprints off and disappears.
You walk in the direction of the music. But after five minutes, you realize that you’re not getting anywhere.
Just when you think you’ll be wandering these tunnels for the rest of your life, the passageway ends! Now you’re facing two doors — one red and one blue. You decide to flip a coin.
Let’s go on the rides first! That roller coaster looked awesome!
Okay! Over this way!
When you reach the rides, you can only stare in amazement. The towering roller coaster, the soaring speedboats, the twisty slides! Every one is in motion. And they’re all empty!
Cool! We have the whole place to ourselves.
Do you think they have rides that don’t go upside down?
Come on! Let’s check out the coaster!
They run off to its starting gate. You stop and crane your neck to gaze up at the coaster’s first hill. And you gasp!
Five minutes later, the three of you are sneaking down a dark alley. Brad is so frightened, he’s practically walking on top of you.
The alley is littered with trash and smells like dead fish.
Hey! Quit stepping on my shoe.
I’m not stepping on your shoe. I’m not anywhere near your stupid shoe.
You glance down. And nearly scream. Brad’s right. He’s not stepping on you. But about a dozen rats are.
You shake your foot wildly. The rats scurry off. Brad catches sight of the rats and tries to bolt. You and Patty quickly pull him back.
Hey! Look! A door!
On the door you see a big sign that reads KEEP OUT, so... you go in.
You turn back and head in the other direction. Your reflections bounce off the walls at crazy angles. Are you walking straight, or have you rounded a corner?
Over here! Turn left again!
Turn left again? Now you are really confused. If you turn left again, will you finally escape?
You cover your head with your hands and try to run into a thick grove of trees. But the bat circles in front of you and dives again.
Stop it! Stop it!
As you turn and race toward some low bushes, you remember the horrible stories about bats making nests in people’s hair.
You spot a big stick in the wet dirt and scoop it up. The bat swoops down at you once more and —
FWAP! You hit it. The bat falls to the ground. And you see it’s on a wire. It’s a mechanical bat.
All part of the ride, you think. You feel much better when you gaze up ahead. There’s a clearing. But when you see what’s there — you scream!
The wheel lands on 38.
Got a winner, got a winner. You’ve won twenty-five points, plus anything you want in the prize room. Step this way.
Eagerly, you follow the bird into a storeroom. It’s packed with the weirdest assortment of junk you’ve ever seen. Dusty old catalogs, stuffed rats, a collection of axes...
So pick something. It’s getting late.
Not this garbage, you think. Then you spot a shelf of small cans with bright labels: PLAY AND GLOW, CLAY SLIME, and MONSTER BLOOD.
I’ll take the Monster Blood.
Excellent choice.
As you quickly leave the room with your prize, you wonder, is twenty-five points enough? What do you do next?

choices.text: Play Guess Your Weight on Mars (you haven't yet).
Proceed to the Final Challenge (you've already played Guess Your Weight).

args.text: You close your eyes. When you open them, your car lunges forward with a burst of speed — and you loop-the-loop. Your mouth drops open to scream, but no sound comes out.
Now your car starts to plunge downward — like an elevator out of control. As you near the bottom, you slow down. You see what’s up ahead. A huge black hole — a tunnel!
As you shoot toward the open mouth of the tunnel, you begin to scream again. The door of the tunnel is about to close!
Snap! The door comes crashing down — behind your car. You breathe out a long sigh. But now you’re in a tunnel so dark that you can’t see a thing.
Five, four, three, two, one. We have liftoff.
To your horror, the rocket blasts off! You’re slammed against the side of the capsule with hurricane force. Seconds later, you’ve left Earth’s atmosphere.

Congratulations. You are the perfect weight for our Mars explorer. We’ll be monitoring your trip and will bring you back in approximately twenty years — with a plus or minus ten-year margin of error...
But do not worry. Nothing can go wrong ... go wrong ... go wrong.
THE END
What do you mean the magic number could save my life?
But the fortune-teller doesn’t answer. She stares off into space, fallen into a deep trance.
You memorize the number anyway. 1–3–2. Madame Zeno waves you away with her jeweled hand.
You leave the tent to search for Patty and Brad. You squint under the bright lights of the midway, scanning all the game booths. But you can’t find them.
A wave of panic washes over you as the walls crumble around you. You throw your arms over your head and close your eyes. Then silence. The shaking stops.
When you open your eyes, you are outside — in the rides area! But the biggest surprise of all is that you spot Patty and Brad!
Boy, am I glad to see you! We’ve got to get out of here before midnight.
No problem. Look. I’m sure the exit is right over there past that ride called the Hall of the Mountain King.
No, it’s that way — near the sign that says ‘Halloween Express.’

choices.text: Go toward the Hall of the Mountain King.

args.text: You are about to scream. It seems like the only sensible thing to do. And then you remember the sign. Reptile Petting Zoo.
You have a crazy idea. You can feel the alligator’s hot breath on your arm. But instead of pulling your arm back, you stretch it out!
What are you doing?!
Your fingers reach out over the alligator’s open snout to the top of his head. And you pet him.
Nice alligator...
Slowly — very slowly — the creature’s mouth begins to shut. Then he rolls over and falls asleep!
You slip quietly off the log, charge for the shore — and plow right into Big Al!
Well, well, well. Look who we have here. Come with me. It’s time for The Final Challenge.
You’re spinning round and round. Everything is a blur. You hear the crowd chanting, 'FI-NAL! FI-NAL! FI-NAL!'
And then the wheel stops. A huge gasp escapes from the audience. Did you win or lose?
Neither. You stopped on SPIN AGAIN.
The giant looms over you. He’s as tall as the tree outside your house — and a lot meaner.
You hurt my feelings.
Then he begins to cry.
I am not a wimp. I am not.
He sure looks like a wimp.
You’re falling... falling... everything passes as if you’re dropping in slow motion. Is this...
THE END? Yes.
The tracks stretch up so high that they seem to touch the clouds. The coaster cars look like space shuttles. They have safety harnesses to keep you in when the ride turns upside down.
You didn’t want to admit it before, but, like Brad, riding upside down is not your favorite thing.
You’re about to walk through the Space Coaster gate when you hear spooky organ music. You turn around. Looming in the distance is a dark and creepy haunted house.
You gaze down at your map. It’s called the House of Horrors. You love haunted houses. Now you’re not sure what to do. The coaster or the haunted house?

choices.text: Join Patty and Brad on the Space Coaster.
Go to the House of Horrors alone.

args.text: Come on! Come on!
Without another word, she races off. You and Brad dash after her through a maze of underground passageways. Then she stops. You find yourself standing outside, in front of a barbed-wire fence!
Up ahead, you spot an opening. 'Let’s go in!' Patty says.
The three of you creep through the fence and trudge through some tall, wet grass. It’s way too dark to see.
But you can hear perfectly. Slithering. And hissing. You spin around, but you can’t find the opening in the fence! You do see something else. A sign!
The wheel stops on FREE SPIN. You are ready to try again. But the dumb parrot flies over and latches onto your shoulder.
Ouch! That hurts.
Free spin, free spin, you’re going on a free spin.
When you swivel your head to glare at the bird, a scream freezes in your throat. The parrot has ballooned into an enormous vulture.
Run! — your every survival instinct shouts. But the bird of prey has other ideas. One of them is dinner — with you as the main course.
The big bird snatches you by the back of your shirt. With a jerk he lifts you off the ground. And suddenly you have a frightening view of the carnival from fifty feet up.
Thummp, thump, thump. Your heart bangs loudly inside your chest. What kind of carnival is this, where a free spin is more like a death sentence?
You circle a green clump of treetops. You’re really dizzy now.
As you circle closer to the treetops, you are met with a horrifying view. Five baby vultures in a nest, five very hungry babies, with mouths gaping wide open.
The end is near. Unless you can somehow force the vulture to let you go. Frantically, you reach into your pockets!

choices.text: You don't have a chocolate bar.

args.text: You can’t take on both monsters, so you decide to wait until one of them leaves.
You grab hold of Dr. Stone’s hand. He’s a lot stronger than he looks. With one small tug, he pulls you free of the web.
Okay. Adjust the net. It’s time to practice spiking.
The monsters leap up. They rub their hands together in evil delight. They untie the net and head to the back of the room.
You close your eyes, hoping this is all a dream. But when you open them, you know it's not. It's a volleyball game. The net has been tied to two huge poles...
And guess what position you play? That’s right. You’re the ball! Watch out for those two-handed spikes!
THE END
The letters on the front of the train car spell 'Right-Way Railroad'.
The chants of the merry-go-round people echo in your head. There’s only one right way. There’s only one right way.
Just as the clock strikes twelve, the train enters a tunnel. You hold your breath. Chug. Chug. Chug.
The choo-choo slowly pulls out of the tunnel — and you are surrounded by carnival workers — everywhere!
Oh, no! You think the space lady guessed right! The two guards shove you into the space chamber. As the door slams shut, one of the guards barks, 'Get on the scale!'
You step up on the scale — and it shows just how right the space lady’s guess was.
You press the chamber-door release, but it’s stuck. 'Hey! I can’t get out!' you yell. But they simply wave.
All at once the room starts to shake and rattle. RRRRRRRR. The thrust of powerful rocket engines echoes in your ears. It sounds as if you’re being launched into space.
Your Halloween Express car pulls up in front of a cottage and the door opens with a creak. You see a skeleton wearing an evil smile. And he lunges right for you!
Trick or treat!
You pound on the gas pedal, and the car shoots forward — out of the skeleton’s grasp! Your heart begins to race as the car speeds out of control.
You tear through an eerie forest, but still you don’t see a way out. And then it comes into view — a service exit!
You check your watch — five minutes to midnight!
Oh, no! Quick, turn left! Don’t stop!
They’re dummies. That’s why they don’t move!
They’ve got to be here somewhere.
You hear Big Al’s voice boom from outside the tent.
Hey! This dummy looks just like the one in that GOOSEBUMPS book.
You mean Night of the Living Dummy?
Then you get an idea.
Remember those magic words that brought the dummy to life in that book? Maybe we can bring this guy to life and he’ll help us.

choices.text: The words are 'karru marri odonna loma molonu karrano'.
The words are 'oooopah lupah dummie dupah'.

args.text: You leap out of the boat. The putrid brown water splashes into your mouth. Gross! You swim a few strokes and your knees scrape the bottom. The water is less than a foot deep!
Slogging through the brown foam, you wade to shore. You’re standing in a dank, eerie forest. Creepy screeches echo through the night mist. And you’re totally lost.
Then — POW! Something black and furry swoops down at you! You duck your head, but it comes at you again and again. A huge bat!
You open the blue door and peer through. You’re staring down a long, pitch-black passageway.
The blue door has locked behind you! There’s nowhere to go but forward. Your knees begin to tremble as you inch your way down the dark hallway.
The passage ends in a bright burst of light. In front of you, a tall purple mountain rises hundreds of feet into the air.
You study the mountain. Cut into its side, you spot a doorway. Above it a brightly painted sign reads: DOOM SLIDE. WILL YOU BE THE ONE TO SLIDE FOREVER?
Steel bars plunge down, pinning you in place. You can’t move. Superstrong headphones clamp over your ears.
Five, four, three, two, one, BLAST OFF!
Smoke and fireworks fill the air as your car starts up the first big hill. It is endless, but the view is awesome. From the top, you can see the midway, the haunted house, and a shadowy swamp.
Neat! There’s AHHHH —
Her words turn into a wild scream as the rocket plunges down the other side of the hill. The wind whips at your face. You are pressed back so hard, you feel like a pancake.
As your car shoots up to the top of the next hill, you’re laughing and screaming at the same time. This is great! But then you make a big mistake.
Blue is your favorite color. You turn the blue card over. There is a message: Help us! You are our only hope. Hurry to the back door of the freak show. Signed, The Freaks.
What does this mean?
Madame Zeno stares deep into your eyes. Her lips tremble. She’s about to speak. And then the lights go out —
A blood-curdling scream rips through the dark!

You start to bolt for the door when a dim light suddenly flickers. Madame Zeno is gone! You reach out to take the card. It bursts into red-hot flames! The entire tent fills with thick smoke. You run for the door.
Outside, you gulp the fresh air. You made it. You glance back. No smoke. No fire. No tent! Everything has disappeared! What should you do now?
There’s a sign! Let’s see what it says.
The three of you race through the wet grass. The hissing is growing louder.
You reach the sign and read it aloud. 'Reptile Petting Zoo!' Whoever heard of a Reptile Petting Zoo!?
This carnival is e-evil.
You’re about to agree when you notice the grass in front of you is swaying. Something is slithering through it. Something big.
Snake!
You know you have to run — but which way? Left or right?

You’re too scared to turn around. Risking a glance over your shoulder, you see a large, dark shape behind you. It’s dark and hairy with muddy leaves and green vines trailing from its body. It’s some sort of swamp monster!
You run as fast as you can. The swamp monster is gaining on you. You have to stop.
You turn and stare right into the swamp monster’s bloody eyes. 'Neat costume,' you say hopefully.
Good try — but the swamp monster isn’t wearing a costume. He’s real and this, unfortunately, is really...
THE END
You decide to wait for Big Al. 'Big Al has to free the freaks,' you say. 'If he doesn’t, we’ll tell him we’re calling the police!'
Big Al bursts into the room.
Free the freaks? The freaks are free to go any time. This prison is just part of the show.
He’ssss lying. We’re prisonersssss.
Oh, come now. You’re not prisoners.
With that he unlocks all the cell doors. Then he turns to you and your friends.
As you can see, the freaks are free. Now, come with me. You haven’t even tried one game on the midway.
Don’t go with him. It’sssss a trick!
Who’s telling the truth?
Bump. A chute opens up. You land headfirst on soft grass. It wasn’t the Doom Slide after all.
As you climb to your feet you hear someone call your name. You glance up and shout for joy. It’s Brad! And Patty’s there, too!
No! This carnival is too weird. And dangerous. We have to get out of here. Now!
Yeah, the faster, the better.
I have an idea. I spotted a back way out of here. But it’s a little risky. We have to squeeze through a barbed-wire fence — and it’s guarded by the carnival’s security forces.
The House of Horrors! You just have to see it.
“I’ll catch up with you guys later,” you call to Patty and Brad. “I’m going to check out the haunted house.”
You glance at your map. The rickety wooden bridge over to your left appears to lead straight there.
As you start across the bridge, the wooden planks creak under your feet. Then the bridge begins to sway over a deep, rocky gorge.
A strong wind blows up from the canyon below. The bridge is swaying wildly now, tossing from side to side.
A massive spear of lightning splits the sky. Thunder rumbles so loudly you jump and lose your balance. “Help!” you scream as you tumble right over the side!

choices.text: Make a grab for the side of the bridge.
Flap your arms and try to fly.

args.text: The walls are closing in faster now. You throw your arms out and try to push them away. But it’s hopeless. You’re going to be crushed like a bug.
You suck in a deep breath — it could be the last breath you take. The floor opens beneath your feet!
You drop down. Down. Down. Down. A long, agonizing scream escapes from your throat as you tumble through space.
Incoming player. Stations, everybody.
A layer of webbing catches you like one of those nets trapeze artists use. Gasping, you bounce up and down.
You start up the brick path to the House of Horrors. Suddenly, someone sneaks up behind you and taps you on the shoulder. You spin around and jump back.
Standing in front of you is a bony skeleton. And it talks.
Don’t go in there. Or you’ll end up like me....
You stare in terror... then you burst out laughing. 'Wow! This is going to be great!'
You’re still chuckling as you push open the giant oak door. It swings back with a long, loud creak.
You step inside and find yourself in a narrow hallway. The door slams shut behind you and the hall turns darker than a starless night.
Thrumpff! Your foot plows into the doctor’s stomach again. But this time, it smashes right through and hits... solid steel!
Aiiii!
You gaze into the gaping hole your sneaker made. Thousands of circuits and wires burn and crackle inside it. The doctor is a robot! Well, an ex-robot now.
That’s the good news. The bad news is headed for you. It’s the monster with the blue horns and red, bulging eyes.
You scramble out of the net and dash toward the door. But the monster is too quick. His tentacle arms shoot out and snatch you. Giant suckers at the ends of his wrists circle your throat.
You slowly lower yourself onto the slide. The bottom tilts underneath you and throws you forward. You’re sliding! Fast!
You hold your breath as you fly through the blackness. A bump sends you bouncing into the air. You scream. And scream.
Oh, no! Could this be the Doom Slide? You hear screams echo in the darkness. They grow louder. Screaming and sliding. And sliding. Never stopping.
Welcome to the rest of your life. Welcome to the Doom Slide!
THE END
'Karru marri odonna loma molonu karrano.' You say the magic words and — the dummy comes to life!
Hey, you. Your face reminds me of a wart I once had removed.
Come on, we brought you to life. We need your help.
I’m sorry... I’m sorry you’re so ugly....
You stare at him and his face grows serious.
You brought me to life, but now you are my slaves. Forever — until...
THE END.
Wait! This isn’t the way this is supposed to end. Quick — you have one last chance.
Midnight strikes. The kiddie train starts to move.
'Nine... ten...' Brad continues counting the chimes.
Brad, shut up. Look at this!
You point to the letters on the front of the train car. You’ve been staring at them the entire time. Why didn’t you notice them before?
Sorry. It’s not your lucky day. As you dash toward the sign, the giant crane scoops the three of you up and drops you off into a hollowed-out log.
You hold your breath as the log teeters on the fall’s edge. As it plunges over, you scream.
At the bottom, the log hits a pool of water and sinks. You’re still holding your breath as you wait to bob to the surface again. But it never happens. You keep going down.
Your last thought is that you’re going to set a world’s record for holding your breath underwater.
THE END
You step up to the Guess Your Weight on Mars booth. A woman in a space suit motions you inside a gate. You find yourself in a courtyard that looks like a miniature launching site.
Security check.
She presses your hand onto a fake scanner.
So how does this game work?
I’ll guess how much you weigh on Mars. Then you’ll enter the planet simulation chamber and stand on the scale. If I’m stumped by more than one pound up or down, you win a giant candy bar.
What if you guess right?
The space lady doesn’t say anything at first. She just smiles. A nasty smile.
You lose.
Your reflexes are great. You jumped out fast enough and escaped the ghost — that ghost. But you didn’t see the other one behind the car — waiting for you.
Your heart hammers away in your chest as it circles you. You're still telling yourself it's not real as the ghost plucks you off your feet.
His black lips part. He opens his mouth — wider and wider. Until it’s as wide as an entrance to a cave. Then he stuffs you inside.
Instantly, you feel lightheaded, then light all over. You peek down at your hands. You can see straight through them. You’ve been turned into a ghost!
As your senses fade, you hear a distant bell chime twelve times. Too bad. The Carnival of Horrors will be one of your favorite haunts — forever!
THE END
Round and round you go. The world is a blur of colors. You can hear the crowd screaming, 'FI-NAL! FI-NAL!'
And the wheel stops. 'Ahhhhhh,' the crowd gasps.
YOU WIN. Now come this way to collect your prize and go home.

The three of you duck inside the Hall of the Mountain King! A painted backdrop of rounded, snowcapped mountains rises on your left. To your right, you spot the ride — wooden carts pulled by real horses.
Come on! Jump in a cart. We’ll be out of here in no time.
No time — that reminds you. You glance at your watch. 11:45! You all scramble into one of the carts and grab the reins.
You gasp. Everything in the painted backdrop is now in front of you. And it has suddenly become real. But different!
The snowcapped mountains rise to black, jagged peaks that pierce the sky. The big stone castle huddles on a scary, dark hill. And the elves — they aren’t picking flowers.

choices.text: Find out what the elves are doing.

args.text: You dig deep into your pocket — and find it! The chocolate bar you won. The big bird starts his final approach, diving straight for the nest.
Treat! Treat!
Yes! He cracks open his claws — just enough for you to wiggle loose. Then you’re falling, falling.
You’ve landed on a giant trampoline. Fwanggg! Now you’re going up again. Higher this time. Now you’re falling again. Fwanggg — you’ve bounced up even higher this time.
It looks as if you’ll be bouncing up and down forever — and boy, is it fun!
THE END!
Let’s head for the midway and play some games!
You, Patty, and Brad jog down a wide avenue. Tents of every color line the street. Carnival music blares from loudspeakers.
You spot a green neon sign flashing above a yellow-striped tent. The sign reads: MADAME ZENO — FORTUNE-TELLER.
Excellent! I’m going in! I'll catch up with you in a minute.
You lift the tent flap. Inside, one small candle flickers in the dark.
Enter my chamber.
There is Madame Zeno, sitting in the shadows. She wears a long red dress dotted with brightly colored gems. Her black hair tumbles to her shoulders as she bends over a large crystal ball.
Welcome. Let me tell you your future.
Madame Zeno studies your hand closely. 'I see horror in your future. In your immediate future,' she warns.
Wh-what kind of horror?
Madame Zeno releases your hand. She picks up a strange deck of cards. The cards have pictures — a headless man, a bloody sword, a large, evil eye.
She gathers up all the cards and flips the deck over. Then she deals out a red card and a blue card.
Turn one over. Learn your fate.
The doctor looms inches away. You'd better decide fast! You decide to kick him and run.
His sour breath fills your nostrils. His fingertips brush your hand and — POW! Your foot flies into his stomach! A direct hit!
But nothing happens. He doesn’t scream. He doesn’t even moan. He simply smiles at you.
Now you’re really scared. You gather up every ounce of courage and strength you have — and kick him once more. Harder!
You turn a corner and are instantly blinded by glaring lights. You are standing in a room of mirrors. Walls. Floor. Ceiling. All mirrors!
You take a few steps forward and — BONK! You hit your head on solid glass.
Totally dizzy, you close your eyes and walk with your hands out. You hear a voice. 'Come this way. Over here.'
You walk toward the voice — BONK — a solid wall again. Finally, your hands find an open doorway! It leads to a mirrored hallway that goes left and right.
You’re lying! You are a robot.
You quickly reach up with both hands and tug at his head. His sharp jaws slash at you. But you’re fast. You hold on firmly and pull!
Oh, no! He really is a monster. And he’s not happy.
You know you’re dead meat, but you have to try one more time. You give his head one more tug. He laughs. Then he gives your head a tug.
Sorry. You’ve gone and lost your head. The only way you’ll be able to face the challenge now is to close the book and begin another day.
THE END
'Oooopah lupah dummie dupah.' You say the magic words and wait. And you wait. The dummy remains the same.
But something strange is happening to you. What are those feathers sprouting out of your skin? And what’s happening to your feet? Are those claws you see growing out of them?
Is it possible that the magic words are turning you — CLUCK — into a chicken? That’s eggs-actly what’s happening.
Well, you laid an egg this time. Let’s hope you won’t be too chicken to try again.
THE END
You squint hard at the road ahead and see why Patty wants you to turn. There they are — the people in the old-fashioned clothes. Only they don’t look the same.
Some have green flesh. Some are deathly white. Their rotting skin hangs from their bones. And they’re all reaching out for you!
Turn! Turn!
You spin the wheel sharply to the left, but you can’t dodge the ghostly creature that’s rising above you. His mouth gapes open to reveal hundreds of blackened, rotting teeth.
He swoops down at you. You turn the steering wheel hard to the right. Too hard — it comes off in your hands!
Jump! Jump and run! Run!
The three of you leap out of the moving car. Are you fast enough? Throw a ball in the air. Try to clap three times before you catch it.
Big Al shoves you and your friends into a huge red tent. Red carpeted steps lead up to a platform under a golden arch twinkling with lights that spell out: FINAL CHALLENGE.
Trumpets blast as people flood into the viewing area. They clap their hands and yell, “FI-NAL. FI-NAL.”
Big Al leads you up the carpeted steps. You are standing on the platform now — in front of a shimmering curtain.
The crowd begins to chant, 'SUD-DEN DEATH. SUD-DEN DEATH.'
What do you think that means?
The giant hangs over you, flexing his muscles. He squints at you as if you are a bug — ready to be squashed.
Did you call me a wimp?
You are much too scared to answer.
You’re right. I am a wimp!
And with that, he bends the bars, and you, Patty, and Brad scramble through.
Follow me. I know a way out of here.
What about the others?
No problem! Here — catch!
Patty grabs keys from a hook on the wall and throws them to you. You quickly unlock all the doors — setting the freaks free!
I don’t know. I don’t think we should take any more risks. Especially not in this crazy carnival.
Don’t you trust me?
You glance at Brad. He stares at the ground.
I just have a bad feeling about this, Patty. Okay?
But Patty doesn’t answer. She throws her shoulders back and stands up taller. And taller. And taller.
You gasp! Patty is growing! She’s nearly ten feet tall! Her skin turns green and lumpy. Horns sprout from her head. Her teeth grow into sharp fangs.
You remember the horrible monsters on the walls of the slide. Patty has turned into one of them!
Too bad you didn’t trust me. I can’t have you ruining my plans.
“Ha-ha-ha!” she cackles. Then she wraps her slimy mouth around your arm and bites down. Hard!
THE END
You’re staring at a sign that reads: WORLD’S FREAKIEST FREAK SHOW! The three of you gape at the pictures. There’s the Three-Headed Man and the Snake Lady.
“This is, uh —” you start to say. But you don’t finish. Because a large hand has come down on your shoulder. Hard.
You slowly turn and gaze up at a huge man with shoulders wider than a refrigerator. He has coal-black eyes with a thick mustache.
What are you doing? You’re not allowed in here.
We’re sorry. We wanted to look around. That’s all. But we’ll leave. Right now.
His eyes stare into yours. He clamps both hands down on your shoulders.
You’re not going anywhere!
You head toward the Boat Trip to Nowhere. At the dock, you spot a stubby guy with long arms. In the strange light of the swamp, his skin shines with an oily, green glow.
Step right up. You can do fifteen knots in these babies. But stay away from the tree stumps.
You watch the little man’s sharp green fingernails tearing the mooring rope apart. As soon as the boat is free, you jump in, step on the gas, and roar away from the dock.
The wind blows hard against your face. You head for a channel that you see up ahead. Too bad you didn’t notice that sign that reads: TO BOOGER BOG.
Dr. Stone extends a long bony hand to pull you from the net. When you peer into his face, his eyes roll up into his head.
Pleased to meet you.
Did he say, 'Pleased to meet you' or 'Pleased to eat you'? You’re not sure, and you don’t want to hang around to find out.
As the doctor lowers his hand, you wriggle your right foot free. You could give him a hard kick in the stomach and make a run for the door. But what about the monsters?
You’d better decide fast!

choices.text: Try to kick the doctor and run.
Wait until one of the monsters leaves.

args.text: NO! At the last minute, you wrench the steering wheel hard to the left. The side of your boat clears the tree with a sickening scrape.
You breathe a sigh of relief, but it ends in a groan. A huge, sharp root below the water has just ripped into the bottom of your boat.
You hear a tearing sound, then gurgling as the cockpit starts to fill with water. More than half your boat is underwater — and you’re going down fast.
Through the mist you spot another boat. 'Hey, over here!' you cry out.
The red-eyed beast leans against you, pressing you hard against the wall. The jagged horns at the top of his head nick your cheeks.
You can’t bear it anymore. You bring your hand up with all your might and shove his head away from yours.
As you watch in horror, the monster’s head rolls off its neck. The head tumbles to the floor and lands at your feet.
That hurt. That really h-h- ...
He never finishes. You’ve destroyed another robot! Now all you have to do is slip by the crusty, alligator-snout creature guarding the door.
You robots aren’t so tough.
Oh, really? Well, maybe not. But what makes you think that I am a robot?
You decide to wait. After fifteen minutes, no one has shown up. A chill runs down your back. You feel as if a thousand pairs of eyes are watching you.
Now that you’re accustomed to the darkness, you can see dozens of tracks leading in and out of the tunnel.
You hear a rustling sound. You freeze. Then you hear a hissing sound — and you smell something odd. A sweet smell, like heavy perfume. It's making you feel strange. Dizzy. Sick.
What a sight! You can hardly believe your eyes! You scream again. It’s Patty and Brad!
Hey, guys, wait up!
The ride stops. Dead. You are sitting in the dark. 'Patty! Brad!' you call. Silence.
You're locked in your harness. In the dim light, you spot dozens of empty space rockets lining the walls. Did your section detach from Patty and Brad’s?

Suddenly, the silence is shattered. Your seat lock grinds open. You quickly spin around. Patty’s and Brad’s cars have disappeared! If this is all part of the ride, maybe you should hop out. But if the ride is broken, maybe you should wait for help.
You sit down on the slide and push off. The world tilts as you plunge down. Down, down, down. It's kind of cool! Sliding and swirling in the darkness.
Until you hear the screams. The eerie screams that follow you as you twist and turn. Oh, no! You must have picked the Doom Slide. You’re going to slide forever!
And then, bump. A chute opens up. You hit the ground hard. You tumble over and finally stop. You're outside!
You scramble to your feet and gaze around. You hear laughter. It seems to be coming from the bright pink building a few feet in front of you.
... they’re swinging axes. Your heart leaps into your throat. The elves move to the roadside now — and they’re chopping down the horse-drawn carts ahead of you!
One cart splinters into a million pieces before your horrified eyes. The elves continue on to the next cart. Their sharp blades slice right through it!
Your horse keeps trotting up the steep path. You’re headed right for the wildly chopping elves!
Do something!
Your hand clamps around the can of Monster Blood in your pocket. Quickly, you snap off the lid and the green gunk pours out.
Look! It’s alive!
He’s right. The Monster Blood oozes from the can, quivers, and appears to stretch and pull itself up! Then it starts to roll and bounce, making horrible sucking sounds.
Great! It’s rolling into the crowd, sucking up everything in its path! 'Run!' Big Al screams as the huge green ball rolls over the people in the crowd.
Then the Monster Blood hits the side of the tent. It changes direction. It’s coming after you!
Well, looks can fool you. He is not a wimp. And he’s mad — at you.
In the next moment, he scoops you up and hurls you at the cell wall. His throw is so forceful, you smash right through the wall and soar out of the carnival grounds.
Congratulations! You escaped the Carnival of Horrors — but not in one piece.
THE END
Okay, get me out of here. Did you help my friends, too?
The dwarf does not answer. He sprints off and you have to race to keep up with him through a confusing maze of twisting tunnels.
The dwarf suddenly stops. 'That way,' he says gruffly, pointing straight ahead. Before you can blink, he vanishes in a puff of smoke!
You’re left standing in front of two doors. One red. One blue. The red one has a sign that reads: DANGER. The blue one has a sign that reads: BIG DANGER.
'Help! Help! Over here!' you scream. 'Hold on!' a deep voice answers through the heavy mist.
The boat turns and speeds toward you. As it nears, the voice calls out again. 'Jump! Jump over!'
The boat is coming closer. You’re about to jump — and the boat speeds right past you. But wait! It is circling back now in a nice, slow approach.
It glides up to you, and gigantic hands pull you onto the boat. 'You saved me!' you cry.
You gaze up and gasp in surprise. The man in the other boat isn’t a man — it’s a monster with a drooling snout and rows of jagged teeth.
Save you? Save you? ... good idea. I won’t eat you now. I’ll save you for a midnight snack!
THE END (Burp!)
You make it! You make it out of the park! You also make it out of the state!
In fact, the last time anyone saw you, Patty, and Brad, you were all a tiny blip on NASA’s radar screen. Congratulations! You escaped from the Carnival of Horrors.
Happy landings! THE END
'I’m not going anywhere with you, Big Al. I believe the Snake Lady!' Patty and Brad echo your sentiment.
That’s too bad. And as for you, Miss Reptilia — I told you, you’ve been overacting. If these kids believe you, we won’t be able to torture them with our real horrors.
Ssssssorry, bosssssss. Sssssso what do you want me to do with them?
You can hardly believe it! Real horrors? 'What kind of carnival is this?!' you shout.
The Carnival of Horrorssssss.
And that's the good news.
'We’ve got to jump,' you tell Patty and Brad. 'It’s our only chance.'
'Okay,' Brad agrees as your cart inches up to the chopping elves. 'Come on,' you cry. 'Now!' But Brad is too paralyzed with fear to move.
Your cart has reached the elves! One of them smirks as he lifts his ax. It’s right above your neck.
With a loud cry, all three of you jump. You land with a thud on a rocky ledge. It breaks your fall. But the rock is too weak to hold all of you.
You scream again as the edge tears loose and the world drops from under your feet. You tumble over and over, down the side of the mountain.
You push open the red door. You realize that you’re sloshing through cold muddy water. It grows deeper and chillier as you go.
With a cold shudder, you decide to head back — until you hear a slurping noise behind you. Whirling around, you watch as giant earthworms crawl out of the mud. Gross!
No way you’re heading back there. You slog onward. Up ahead, you see a dim green light. An exit.
As you reach the end of the tunnel, you hear a low growl behind you. Thudding footsteps. Getting closer. And closer. And now it’s breathing down your neck!
It’s a tree branch! Grabbing at you. Tugging at your hair. Suddenly, you feel something wrap itself around your arms. Then your legs. Closing in tighter. Tighter.
You gaze down and see them — black knobby tree limbs twisting around you. Strangling you.
You drop the steering wheel and begin to claw at the branches. Then you peer up — and see a terrifying sight. A huge tree. You’re headed straight for it! The tree is just inches away.
Are you going to CRASH?!
Unless what? Tell me!
You can escape the Carnival of Horrors if you leave before closing time. When the last ride stops.... At midnight.
You glance at your watch — 11:40. Twenty minutes. But how do you get out of here? The lady says, 'There’s only one right way.'
All around you, the crowd begins to chant. 'ONLY ONE RIGHT WAY, ONLY ONE RIGHT WAY.'
But it’s not midnight yet. There’s still time to figure it out. Until the floor begins to tremble. And the walls begin to shake. Earthquake!
'Sorry, Brad. I think Patty’s right,' you tell him. 'I think I spotted an exit there when we first came in.'
Look! There’s the path. It leads past the Hall of the Mountain King to the exit.
Yeah, but who are those people up there? They’re blocking the way.
You peer up ahead and see them — the people in the old-fashioned clothes. And they’re still chanting — 'Only one right way, only one right way.'
They’re not going to let us out!
Okay. I have an idea. Let’s go into the Mountain King ride — maybe we can jump off at the end and sneak past them.

choices.text: Go on the Mountain King ride.

args.text: 'We’ve got to get out of here, it’s almost midnight,' you say as you run toward the Halloween Express ride.
Hey, maybe we should try one of these cars.
The three of you crowd into a little car that’s really meant for two. You jam your foot on the gas pedal, and you’re flying!
All right! We’re on our way home! Hey, I wonder why they call this Halloween Express?
You turn the wheel sharply to the left, and then you know why....
You squeeze your eyes shut and wait for the crash. Finally, you land. You glance up. You’re at the foot of the Log Flume ride.
You, Patty, and Brad have lots of cuts and bruises, but you’re okay! Terrific! ... until you spot the army of elves with their axes. They’re rushing down the mountain toward you!
The only escape is to enter the flume ride, so you dash inside. As you glance around, you spot an EXIT sign. Then to your horror, you see a giant crane swinging your way. 'Duck!' you scream.
Will you make it to the exit? Is this your lucky day?

choices.text: It's Monday, Wednesday, Friday, or Saturday.

args.text: Something tells you that this monster is not a robot. This one is for real. A drop of his drool drips on your hand. It sizzles and burns.
This is the end, you figure. The monster lifts his gigantic, clawed hand. He waves it over your head.

But that’s not what happens. The monster slowly lowers his hand and clutches at his own neck, and then — pulls his own head off! And when you discover what’s underneath, you know you’re still in big trouble!

Your pulse pounds in your ears as you carefully lift yourself out of the car. The tunnel is dark and musty and really creepy. In the distance, you spot several red lights that seem to lead to other dimly lit tunnels.
Overhead something dark and slimy drips. Splattering on the top of your head. Stinging your forehead. As you desperately try to wipe the burning slime away, something grabs you by the knees!
Aaaah! You look down. A pair of red-rimmed eyes meet yours. It’s a dwarf with scraggly red hair and a toothless smile.
Want me to lead you out of here, kid?
You’re about to follow the dwarf, but then you stop. Is he part of the ride? He looks really evil.

choices.text: Decide not to follow the dwarf.

args.text: Yeoow! Someone splashes cold water in your face. Your eyes open. 'Come on! Wake up! It’s almost show time,' a raspy voice says.
'Show time?' you say, gazing into the eyes of a dwarf. 'What show?' 'The Freak Show. You are the Amazing Siamese Triplets.'
You glance around and see Patty on one side of you and Brad on the other. You try to pull away from them, but you can’t.
We’re stuck together with some kind of glue.
It isn’t glue.
Well, whatever it is — you are stuck. Stuck between your arguing friends for a long, long time — like forever. This really is...
THE END
Help some freaks? That’s a good one! You laugh. You think about Madame Zeno, the fire, and the disappearing tent. Totally cool special effects.
You search for your friends in the big wooden booths that line the midway. Instead, you find incredible games of chance. You can’t wait to play!
You spot a booth across the midway with a crowd gathered in front. That’s odd, you think. Didn’t Big Al say we were the only people at the carnival tonight? You move closer.
'Oh. I get it,' you say aloud. 'These people must work at the carnival.' You’re about to call out to them. Until you see their eyes. Strange, haunted eyes.
This is your lucky day. You duck as the crane swings over your head. 'Run!' you shout to your friends.
You glance at your watch — 11:55. If you’re really lucky, you can still make it out of the carnival by midnight.
You can see the exit up ahead. As you charge through the gate, you feel really hopeful — until you run into Big Al.
No one escapes from the Carnival of Horrors!
You’ve got to find a way out. Now! To your right is the entrance to Halloween Express. Or maybe you should run down a different path.
There’s nothing in your pocket but lint. 'Help! Save me!' you cry. The vulture swoops down and drops you in the nest.
The baby vultures approach. Mouths open — ready to peck you to death... But — good news! They don’t eat you. You fall out of the nest instead.
THUD! Not fast enough. Okay, don’t go to pieces. Pull yourself together and prepare to visit the Carnival of Horrors again — the next time you’re brave enough to open this book!
THE END
ZAP! Big Al throws a switch and the magnet shuts off. You come flying down to earth — right where Brad and Patty are waiting.
I played your dumb game. Now, let us go!
Big Al doesn’t answer. But the crowd does. 'SUD-DEN DEATH! SUD-DEN DEATH!'
The crowd surges toward you. They back you up against a wall. You’re trapped. You reach into your pocket, hoping to find something that might help you.

choices.text: Use the can of Monster Blood.
Run for it (you don't have Monster Blood).

args.text: You open the door and enter a room bursting with people who seem to be waiting for you. They’re all dressed up in old-fashioned costumes.
Welcome to the Carnival of Horrors. Nice of you to join us.
The words send shivers down your spine. The woman whispers in your ear, 'Don’t you want to know the secret of the Carnival of Horrors?' You nod yes.
The Carnival of Horrors comes alive in a different place and a different time each night. And every place we stop, we invite kids like you to join us….
I’m sorry. You can never escape from the Carnival of Horrors. Unless...
You turn left. Somewhere ahead of you, you hear laughter. 'Is somebody there?' you call out. Silence.
You inch forward a few more steps — moving toward the laughter. Slowly.
Over here.
But now the voice seems to be coming from behind you!
You take charge of the reins to urge the horse on. 'Giddyap, boy,' you and Patty shout. But your horse won’t move any faster.
You shoot a glance up ahead. The elves are chopping... and a shiny blade... is now... right over... your head!
No! Let me out of here.
You feel a sharp pain. You’ve just had the shortest haircut of your life. Unfortunately, they took a little too much off the top.
THE END
The bad news is the Snake Lady fooled you. 'Throw them into the large cell with Harold and all the other prisoners,' Big Al commands.
You are shoved into a dark cell. You hear a click. You’re locked in. As the Snake Lady leaves with Big Al, you can hear their laughter echo down the hall.
You peer into the darkness of your cell. There’s no way you could miss him. Harold is a giant. He’s huge. His arms look like tree trunks.
At first you are afraid of him, but then you think, Hey! He’s trapped, too. Maybe we can convince him to help us. And then you get a big idea!
You grab the sides of the slide and lower yourself down. The second you sit, the slide’s floor tilts up and propels you forward. You shriek!
Your eyes dart frantically from side to side. Faces suddenly appear in the darkness in bright flashes of light. Faces of hideous monsters with deformed heads and oozing flesh.
You slide and slide — until you’re covered in the thick, heavy blackness again. You scream as you round a sharp curve. Then you hear the screams. Chilling screams that echo through the darkness.
Oh, no! You must have picked the Doom Slide!
I am not a robot. I am not going to shut down. So don’t bother with any of your silly, human tricks!
You study him hard. Is he lying? Or could he be a lot more dangerous? Your knees begin to tremble when you think about never going home.
You stare deeply into the evil eyes of the creature. Robot? Real monster? You finally decide!

choices.text: It's a robot. Knock his head off.
It's a real monster. Stay cool.

args.text: The Final Challenge! Remember — the fun games are over. Now you are playing for your life. You go first.
You see Brad and Patty taken off to the side by a huge man in a black hood. Two red-haired dwarfs in clown costumes scurry up the steps. They fit you with new high-top sneakers with metal studs.
This is going to be some kind of race, you think. But then you change your mind — when they snap a heavy, metal helmet on your head.
Big Al throws a switch. The curtain behind you parts and — Whammo! The wall behind the curtain turns into a super magnet. You go zinging to the wall like a dart to a bull’s-eye.
'FI-NAL! FI-NAL! FI-NAL!' you hear the crowd yelling as you spin round and round. You’re getting dizzy. Really dizzy. So dizzy that you faint.
'This way!' You wave to Patty and Brad. The three of you turn to the left and keep running — straight into a pond!
You turn around and slog your way back to shore. Patty and Brad make it there first. You are a few feet away — when you see it. An alligator.
With its mouth gaping open — revealing two rows of razor-sharp teeth. You freeze.
Quick! There’s a log! Jump on it!
You scramble up on the log, but it’s no use. You’re still an easy target. The alligator opens its huge mouth even wider. He slithers right up to the log. He's ready to crunch down on you!
'Yay! Our hero!' the freaks cheer as they bolt out of their cells. You follow the giant through a side exit. And in no time, you’re leading all your new friends to your house.
You’re sure your parents won’t mind taking them in. After all, how much can a three-hundred-pound giant, a five-hundred-pound fat lady, and a three-headed man eat?
Just be happy that you’ve come to... THE END
You’re not fast enough to get away from the ghost. You’re running now, but the ghost swoops down in front of you. You plow into him — and pass right through him!
The carnival people are swarming after you. 'Hurry!' you yell to your friends — only three minutes to midnight! They carry torches with flames that leap high in the air.
You glance at your watch — 11:58. 'We can’t let them catch us!' you scream. 'Let’s hide!'
Up ahead you see a gigantic cannon. You also spot a baby ride — the baby choo-choo train. Quick! Pick one!
You squeeze into the choo-choo and scrunch down. 11:59. Lights from the carnival people’s torches sweep over you. Their foul smell fills your lungs.
You hear someone shout in the distance. 'Closing time!' And then you hear a bell start to chime... Midnight!
One, two, three...
You want to strangle him! 'Four, five ...' Suddenly, the kiddie train starts to move. 'Six ... seven ... eight ...'
You sit up and what you see is the biggest shock of this whole horrible night....
The Monster Blood has grown so big — now you can’t see over it or around it. 'Run for your lives!' Patty screams. But reaching the door is impossible.
The mound of green slime is bearing down on you. Fast! You stand frozen to the spot. Terrified. And then — just in time — you, Patty, and Brad leap to the side.
The Monster Blood slams into the wall with a crushing force — and plows right through it.
You stare at the giant gaping hole in the wall. Quickly, the three of you jump through the opening. You are standing outside the main gate — where you came in!
From somewhere, a clock chimes twelve times. And when you peer back at the carnival, it has disappeared. All that’s left is a spooky silver mist.
THE END
You and your friends squeeze into the cannon. 'Ouch! You’re sitting on my hand,' Brad whines.
But you don’t have time to apologize. 'Do you smell something... burning?' you ask.
BOOM! There’s a tremendous explosion. You fly through space. You are headed for a fence that encloses the carnival, and the field beyond.
SUCKER! You didn’t really think you could get out this easily, did you? Check out the title of this book: Escape from the Carnival of Horrors.
Horrors! You need to face a lot more horrors — and then (maybe) you’ll escape.
The fortune-teller said this number might save your life. But how? Then you see it. In the corner. A tall silver locker with the number 132 painted in red.
In here!
You push Patty and Brad inside. As soon as you close the door, the locker begins to rattle and shake. You’re nearly blinded by a bright, white light.
You hear a loud whooshing sound. And then all is silent. The door pops open — and you’re amazed at what you see.
Those eyes behind the alligator snout — those beady eyes. You should have recognized them before. It’s Big Al.
Hey! You did a great job here. You’ve really got the stuff for the Carnival of Horrors. Aren't you having fun?
Uh, yeah. It’s been really great. But I really do have to get home.
I’m afraid that isn’t possible. Just open the door and you’ll understand.
You’ve got to figure out what you weigh on Mars. Fast. You notice a flashing sign: THE GRAVITY ON MARS IS ALMOST 40 PERCENT OF WHAT IT IS ON EARTH.
Multiply your real Earth weight by four. Now drop off the last digit. For example, if you weigh 90 pounds, 90 × 4 = 360. Dropping off the last digit, you get 36 for your weight on Mars.

choices.text: My Mars weight is less than 37 or more than 39.

args.text: You open the door and climb a steep ramp. Halfway up, you stop. There’s another sign: WARNING! — YOU MAY BE THE ONE TO SLIDE TO YOUR DOOM!
You continue to the top and find yourself on a wide, dimly lit platform. A row of long, curving slides stretches out before you, numbered one to ten.

You think hard. The Doom Slide. You remember it from a GOOSEBUMPS book you read! One Day at HorrorLand. If you pick the wrong slide, you’ll spend the rest of your life sliding — forever! Which number is the Doom Slide?
